name: Tiny Brains
description: "Tiny Brains" is a cooperative action puzzler that follows four super-powered lab animals in their attempt to escape a mad scientist's experiments. In this joyously chaotic multiplayer game, the four "Tiny Brains" must combine their unique physics-based powers to navigate through a trick-ridden maze.
minimum_requirements: OS: Vista, 7, 8 Processor: P4 3 Ghz or Athlon 3400 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB Video Memory with Shader Model 3.0 support; ATI Radeon X1600XT / NVIDEA GeForce 7800GS DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: Me and a friend played and it took us like 2 hrs to do the campaign. It was a nice short game that was actually quite fun. The puzzle mechanics and switching characters between the two of us was sometimes a challenge and a lot of laughs had.

Got this on sale for $1 and for that price it is completely worth it. It's not a long game but it is enough. You have a short story mode (2.5 hours) and then you can do some puzzles and other things. I played coop and had a great time. My friend lives overseas and we did experience some lag for the person not hosting. That makes some of the puzzles very tough but they are still doable.  Buy this on sale, grab a controller and a friend and enjoy.
This game is amazingly fun and challenging, well worth the money!
Very fun coop game, altough it's a bit too short.
Awesomely fun game to co-op! Haven't tried any of the other game modes but can really recommend going with a friend.

A great puzzle co-op game, and is even more ridiculously fun with 4 player couch co-op, especially on challenge modes. The humor in the game is quite good, and the art direction is very good as well.  There is also a hardcore difficulty, where you get a character with all of the abilities, but can't respawn for all of those people looking for a challenge.  Be forewarned, don't get this for full price if you only intend to play the main story. As this game is less than two hours in length if you have a good grasp on the puzzle mechanics.(story mode only, challenge modes and hardcore difficulty ramp this up significantly i'd assume)  Overall if you have at least a friend to play this with, i feel it's worth it if you can get it for a decent price. It's a great romp while it lasts, and the challenge modes(the ball challenges specifically) are highly entertaining with 4 people.

There are too many bugs in this game to deem it worthy of playing. It was unplayable with myself and three other friends across the internet. It's a good game idea executed poorly. The interface in the game also done very poorly and you are unable to tell what certain actions will do or what they are doing.

I'm seriously considering off'ing myself after playing this game. After waiting four HOURS just to download it, my friends and I had to wait thirty minutes just to start playing. After going through the elongated and repetitive tutorial, we all decided to just claw our eyes out with forks instead for entertainment. After finishing the first level, (and suffering through endless lag spikes), Our screens went white and forced us back to the home screen. No offence to the creators, but next time get game programmers to make your games. This is all for now, just please don't get the game unless you are ready to end it all. Thank you for reading.

Barely an hour and a half long (played with one other person, the fact it has FOUR player co-op blows my mind) incredibly simplistic puzzles, and then really shoddy online combined with wonky physics leaving us both just going 'what?' during half the game. On top of all of that visual glitches occuring during the final encounter made it far more difficult than it actually was, on top of wonky physics. Nevermind the fact that the controls in general are bad. Aiming the powers is a nightmare half the time and switching characters isn't good either.  I only spent 99¢ and I regret it!

If you're thinking of buying this to play online, I would recommend this game only if you don't mind restarting the game after each stage, lag spikes of several seconds, missing textures, and desync issues.  Maybe buy this if it's on sale for 50p, otherwise just wait for an update that fixes multiplayer!

For a game meant to be played cooperatively with friends, it was AWFULLY difficult---in fact, IMPOSSIBLE---to successfully invite and/or join any given game. I’m not the only one who has experienced this; it’s a known issue, which has apparently fallen upon deaf ears.  It’s a mighty shame, as there’s clearly a lot of care and effort put into the art style, which is easily the most (and, perhaps, only) enjoyable aspect of this game.  I absolutely cannot recommend Tiny Brains, even at sale price.
I didn't have a lot of time to play but it is awesome ! Great job guys ;)
♥♥♥♥ game is ♥♥♥♥.

Surprisingly not a bad puzzle game. It actually gets quite fun and you do get carried away with the game. I thought this would be a pretty bad game because I don't really enjoy the whole puzzle genre but if you play it with some friends it actually turns out to be quite fun.
This is the best and most enjoyable platform style co-op game I have played since I was a kid. Worth every moment; too bad it only takes about 4 hours. I could have played all day.

Picked up the game during a sale for 99ct and was worth every penny. We had a blast playing this sort of puzzlegame with 4 four player over internet with steam friends. In the forum some of the people seams not to be able to set up a coop game, but it seams those are eather wrong or for an older version. We had no issues. The difficulty level goes up during the second chapter. At a point on chaper 3 we had to give up where you apperently had to swich a char in a mid air jump, but maybe we are just not skilled enouth for that :-)  Game compairs to Portal2 and Trine. Its fun to play with friends. I would recomend to pick up a controler to play.
very very funny to play together

Tiny Brains is a decent enough puzzle-platformer for two or more players. I can not imagine playing it alone, so make sure you have someone with you, as the game is not just for two players, it is pretty much only enjoyable this way.  Anyway, you control four mice that have unique powers(Push, Suck, Switch-positions, and Freezing) and all their powers combine to help you get through the increasingly harder levels. The game has a cute look and the puzzles are usually quite satisfying to solve.  However, the game does lean towards being very rage-inducing. Some of the puzzles involve keeping a little critter alive while it is being attacked by waves on enemies. It's not fun and can drive just about anyone made. Other puzzles involve pushing a ball through a complicated hole-filled maze. They are not fun, either.  The majority of the puzzles, though, are wonderful little rooms(think of Portal) that require solving something in order to open the exit. These are all great and a lot of fun to solve with a friend. If they make a sequel, they should focus on these kind of puzzles exclusively.   Room puzzles - 8/10  Non-room puzzles - 4/10  Overall, this game is worth 6/10 to me.

This game is AWESOME! The puzzles would be less complicated once there is more than one person playing, but still, you can still complete the puzzles alone, as you have access to all four rodents. Get it while it is on discount! You won't regret it (unless you do not like solving puzzles).
Great game in both single player and multiplayer with friends. Love replaying the challenges with friends when they come over to the house.

I have two words to say about this game: freaking cool!  The main story isn't that long but it is incredibly fun, especially with friends. Then there are challenges, PvP mini-games etc. There is enough stuff to do in this game to keep you busy for a while and it's fun so if you like puzzle-platform games I would definetly recomend this game.

This game is so much fun. A great local co-op experience. The puzzles were great, non of them were too difficult, but they weren't so easy that I wasn't engaged and had the answer immediately. I also really enjoyed the campaign. It was funny and clever. The art was appealing. I recommend this.
This is a great coop game to play with a non-gamer wife or girlfriend. Some parts will be hard fast-paced action for them, but most of it is very doable puzzles.
